text: Paul William "Bear" Bryant (September 11, 1913 â€“ January 26, 1983) was an American college football coach. He was best known as the head coach of the University of Alabama football team. During his twenty-five years as Alabama's head coach, his teams won six national championships and thirteen conference championships. When he retired in 1982 he held the record for most wins as head coach in college football history. At the University of Alabama, the Paul W. Bryant Museum, Paul W. Bryant Drive and Bryant-Denny Stadium are all named in his honor. Before he worked at Alabama, Bryant was head football coach at University of Maryland, the University of Kentucky, and Texas A&M; University. ==Other websites== * Paul W.
